intro: Dendrocnide cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-shaped stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fine, hair-like structures that release a potent irritant when touched. The plant belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other stinging plants. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in clusters, and it produces berries that are toxic to humans. Dendrocnide cordifolia is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
